newsitem.title: GERMANY: Holbrooke warns Karadzic he must face trial.
newsitem.headline: Holbrooke warns Karadzic he must face trial.

text.p: U.S. envoy Richard Holbrooke has warned indicted war criminals such as Bosnian Serb hardliner Radovan Karadzic they could face the same fate as other suspects apprehended by international peacekeepers.
"A free Karadzic is incompatible with a peaceful Bosnia," Holbooke was quoted as saying in an interview with German news weekly Focus.
Troops from the NATO-led Stabilisation Force (SFOR) last month captured one suspect and shot dead another, former local police chief Simo Drljaca, in Prijedor, northwestern Bosnia.
"What happened in Prijedor was a warning for everyone," Holbrooke said.
"The police chief there, who was wanted as a war criminal, practically committed suicide. He was surrounded by British troops and shot back nevertheless. He could also have surrendered."

Holbrooke said he had told Yugoslav President Slobodan Milosevic and Momcilo Krajisnik, the Serb member of Bosnia's presidency, that Karadzic must be delivered to the international war crimes tribunal in The Haugue.
"If they refuse to make him give himself up voluntarily, they are risking a great deal," Holbrooke told Focus in the interview, released ahead of publication on Monday.
